alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:18PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN MORGAN...HENDRICKS...EASTERN BOONE AND SOUTHEASTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 1118 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lebanon to near Danville to near Greencastle, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Brownsburg, Zionsville, Avon, Pittsboro and Whitestown around 1125 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Plainfield, Brooklyn, Monrovia, Lake Hart and Mooresville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 128 and 142. Interstate 70 between mile markers 37 and 68. Interstate 74 between mile markers 54 and 69. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and west central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
